org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.components.scale

Class ExponentialRamp

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.components.scale.Ramp
      • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.components.scale.ExponentialRamp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IScale

    public class ExponentialRamp
extends Ramp
    This ramp is built from two points and creates an exponential function that takes an x value as an input and gives a y value as output. The ramp also can take in a y value and give the inverse.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ExponentialRamp(Point point1, Point point2)
      This ramp's function -- f(x) -- is built using the two points passed into the constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected double inverse(double y)
      Uses the y value passed in to calculate the inverse value of f(x)
      protected double scale(double x)
      Uses the x value passed in to calculate the value of f(x)

      • Methods inherited from class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.components.scale.Ramp

        getPoint1, getPoint2, scaleX, scaleY

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExponentialRamp

        public ExponentialRamp(Point point1,
                       Point point2)
        This ramp's function -- f(x) -- is built using the two points passed into the constructor. From these points it builds a exponential function
        Parameters:
        point1 - The first point the exponential ramp run through.
        point2 - The second point the exponential ramp runs through.
        See Also:
        Point

        protected double scale(double x)
        Uses the x value passed in to calculate the value of f(x)
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        x - the x value to be scaled by the ramp
        Returns:

      • inverse

        protected double inverse(double y)
        Uses the y value passed in to calculate the inverse value of f(x)
        Specified by:
        inverse in class Ramp
        Parameters:
        y - the y value to be inversely scaled by the ramp
        Returns:
